**The Rogue Gear-Spirits** is the [gnomish](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)") [Ranger](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger") [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"). It is the prize for completing the [Gnomish Ranger Quest](/wiki/Gnomish_Ranger_Quest "Gnomish Ranger Quest"), and is [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral")-aligned. Its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") type is a [crossbow](/wiki/Crossbow "Crossbow").

When carried, The Rogue Gear-Spirits confers [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy"), [warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning") and [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"). When wielded, it grants +1d5 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and double damage, both to each arrow fired and to any damage it does in melee - when using it as a melee weapon, it is treated as a double-damage [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe") that deals piercing and blunt damage. Wielding the artifact additionally confers [automatic searching](/wiki/Automatic_searching "Automatic searching") and adds its enhancement as a bonus to manual [search](/wiki/Search "Search") attempts.

[Invoking](/wiki/Invoking "Invoking") The Rogue Gear-Spirits allows you to [untrap](/wiki/Untrap "Untrap") an applicable square. [Firing](/wiki/Firing "Firing") [crossbow bolts](/wiki/Crossbow_bolt "Crossbow bolt") from The Rogue Gear-Spirits will always shoot at least 2 bolts instead of 1; if no ammo is quivered, it will automatically create and fire +0 crossbow bolts. [Applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") The Rogue Gear-Spirits allows you to dig as with a pick-axe, and each application will cause the artifact to supply a random [rumor](/wiki/Rumor "Rumor"); the rumor will be true or false based on the artifact's [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude").

The Rogue Gear-Spirits is the gnomish Ranger quest artifact in dNetHack. It is the prize for completing the Gnomish Ranger Quest, and is neutral-aligned. Its base item type is a crossbow.

When carried, The Rogue Gear-Spirits confers telepathy, warning and fire resistance. When wielded, it grants +1d5 to-hit and double damage, both to each arrow fired and to any damage it does in melee - when using it as a melee weapon, it is treated as a double-damage pick-axe that deals piercing and blunt damage. Wielding the artifact additionally confers automatic searching and adds its enhancement as a bonus to manual search attempts.

Invoking The Rogue Gear-Spirits allows you to untrap an applicable square. Firing crossbow bolts from The Rogue Gear-Spirits will always shoot at least 2 bolts instead of 1; if no ammo is quivered, it will automatically create and fire +0 crossbow bolts. Applying The Rogue Gear-Spirits allows you to dig as with a pick-axe, and each application will cause the artifact to supply a random rumor; the rumor will be true or false based on the artifact's beatitude.
